unnormalised: **5G Rollout Accelerates Across India, Driven by Major Telcos**
normalised: five G rollout accelerates across India, driven by major telcos

unnormalised: New Delhi – The nationwide rollout of 5G services continues at a rapid pace, with Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio leading the charge. Both companies are aggressively expanding their networks, aiming to cover key metropolitan areas and industrial hubs by the end of 2024.
normalised: New Delhi – The nationwide rollout of five G services continues at a rapid pace, with Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio leading the charge. Both companies are aggressively expanding their networks, aiming to cover key metropolitan areas and industrial hubs by the end of two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Reliance Jio, at the AGM held on 28/08/2023, reaffirmed its commitment to investing Rs. 2 lakh crore in infrastructure development. Airtel announced expansion plans covering an additional 5,000 km in the North-East by 15/11/2023.
normalised: Reliance Jio, at the A G M held on twenty eighth august two thousand and twenty three, reaffirmed its commitment to investing rupee two lakh crore in infrastructure development. Airtel announced expansion plans covering an additional five thousand kilometer in the North-East by fifteenth november two thousand and twenty three.

unnormalised: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) confirmed at 14:00 hrs yesterday that spectrum allocation for the next phase is expected to begin in Q1 of 2024. This will enable smaller players to join the 5G race, promoting wider coverage and affordability. Initial reports suggest improved download speeds exceeding 200 Mbps are being experienced in areas with upgraded infrastructure. Concerns about potential radiation hazards are being addressed through public awareness campaigns and adherence to strict international safety standards. Experts at IIT Madras are conducting further research on the impact of 5G technology.
normalised: The Department of Telecommunications (D O T) confirmed at two P M yesterday that spectrum allocation for the next phase is expected to begin in Q one of two thousand and twenty four. This will enable smaller players to join the five G race, promoting wider coverage and affordability. Initial reports suggest improved download speeds exceeding two hundred M B P S are being experienced in areas with upgraded infrastructure. Concerns about potential radiation hazards are being addressed through public awareness campaigns and adherence to strict international safety standards. Experts at I I T Madras are conducting further research on the impact of five G technology.
